```js
console.log('Hello World');
```

# Brigid - Introduction





import { getPageTreePeers } from 'fumadocs-core/page-tree';
import { source } from '@/lib/source';

## Features Overview

<img alt="Overview" src={__img0} placeholder="blur" />

<Cards>
  {getPageTreePeers(source.getPageTree('en'), '/en/docs/core-features').map((peer) => (
      <Card key={peer.url} title={peer.name} href={peer.url}>
        {peer.description}
      </Card>
    ))}
</Cards>

***


# DICOM Management





<img alt="DICOM Management preview animation" src={__img0} placeholder="blur" />

## ğŸ“„ DICOM Management Features

Brigid supports comprehensive DICOM image management, including retrieval, access, and deletion.

## ğŸ“‚ Intuitive Hierarchical Management

Brigid organizes images according to the DICOM standard into `Study` â†’ `Series` â†’ `Instance` levels. Just like using folders, you can start from a patient's single exam and dive into each image detail.

## ğŸ–¼ï¸ Customized View Layouts

You can freely switch between layouts based on your current needs:

* Table mode: List presentation, data clear at a glance.
* Card mode: Visual preview, quickly lock the image.


# DICOM Sharing





<img alt="DICOM Sharing preview animation" src={__img0} />

## DICOM Sharing Features

Brigid provides a robust DICOM sharing mechanism to ensure smooth information exchange while maintaining data security during cross-team collaboration.

* Custom Identification: Set "Share Name" and "Description" to track and manage easily.
* Permission Control:
  * Operation Permissions: Supports `READ` (view/download) and `EDIT` (edit tag) permissions.
  * Object Management: Specify `Specific Users` or `Everyone` access.
* Security Mechanisms:
  * Password Protection: Requires entering the correct password to access.
  * Expiration Date: Set `Expiration Date`, the link will automatically expire after the expiration date.


# DICOM Viewer





<img alt="DICOM Viewer preview animation" src={__img0} />

Brigid integrates a professional open-source DICOM Viewer - [BlueLight Viewer](https://github.com/cylab-tw/bluelight), providing a smooth web-based medical image viewing experience.


# Event Logs





<img alt="Event Logs preview screenshot" src={__img0} placeholder="blur" />

Brigid features a built-in event logging system that records various operations within the platform. Administrators can monitor system status, track user activities, and perform rapid troubleshooting when anomalies occur.

## Key Features

* **Log Viewing**: Real-time access to all event records generated by the system.
* **Multi-dimensional Filtering**:
  * **Level Filter**: Supports three levelsâ€”`Info`, `Warning`, and `Error`â€”to help quickly isolate critical issues.
  * **Name Filter**: Enables precise searches for specific DICOM operations and system behaviors.

## Supported Event Types (Event Names)

To facilitate management and precise troubleshooting, Brigid categorizes DICOM-related events into the following groups. You can filter records based on these specific event names:

| Category                | Supported Event Names                                                                                    |
| :---------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Storage**             | `storeInstance`                                                                                          |
| **Search**              | `searchStudies`, `searchSeries`, `searchInstances`, `searchStudySeries`, `searchStudySeriesInstances`    |
| **Retrieve**            | `retrieveStudy`, `retrieveSeries`, `retrieveInstance`                                                    |
| **Rendered Retrieval**  | `retrieveRenderedSeries`, `retrieveRenderedInstance`, `retrieveRenderedFrames`, `retrieveFramePixelData` |
| **Thumbnail Retrieval** | `retrieveStudyThumbnail`, `retrieveSeriesThumbnail`, `retrieveInstanceThumbnail`                         |
| **Metadata Retrieval**  | `retrieveStudyMetadata`, `retrieveSeriesMetadata`, `retrieveInstanceMetadata`                            |


# Executable Application





<img alt="Executable Application preview animation" src={__img0} />

Brigid provides executable applications, making it easy for users to start using quickly.

You can download the executable application from the [Releases](https://github.com/Brigid-DICOM/brigid/releases) page.


# Core Features

# Multi-Workspaces





<img alt="Multi-Workspaces preview animation" src={__img0} />

## Multi-Workspaces Features

Brigid supports multi-workspace architecture, allowing users to create and manage multiple workspaces.

* Workspace Management: Create, delete, and manage workspaces
* Workspace Collaboration: Collaborate with other users in the same workspace


# Upload DICOM





<img alt="Upload DICOM preview animation" src={__img0} />

Brigid uses the STOW-RS protocol (`/workspaces/:workspaceId/studies`) to implement the DICOM upload feature, making it easy for users to upload DICOM files.


# Advanced Usage

      <Card key={peer.url} title={peer.name} href={peer.url}>
        {peer.description}
      </Card>
    ))}
</Cards>


# Authentication



## Next Auth Authentication Environment Variables

### General Settings

#### `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH`

* Type: boolean (optional)
* Description: Whether to enable the authentication system
* Default: `false`
* Example: `true`

#### `NEXTAUTH_SECRET`

* Type: string (required)
* Description: The secret key for NextAuth (Auth.js)
* Default: None
* Example: `a-very-long-and-secure-random-string-at-least-32-chars`

#### `NEXTAUTH_URL`

* Type: string (optional)
* Description: The URL for NextAuth (Auth.js)
* Default: `http://localhost:3119`
* Example: `https://brigid.example.com`

### Casdoor

#### `AUTH_CASDOOR_ID`

* Type: string (optional)
* Description: The Client ID for Casdoor
* Default: None
* Example: `casdoor_id`

#### `AUTH_CASDOOR_SECRET`

* Type: string (optional)
* Description: The Secret for Casdoor
* Default: None
* Example: `casdoor_secret`

#### `AUTH_CASDOOR_ISSUER`

* Type: string (optional)
* Description: The Issuer for Casdoor (usually the URL of Casdoor)
* Default: None
* Example: `https://casdoor.example.com`

### GitHub

#### `AUTH_GITHUB_ID`

* Type: string (optional)
* Description: The Client ID for GitHub
* Default: None
* Example: `github_id`

#### `AUTH_GITHUB_SECRET`

* Type: string (optional)
* Description: The Secret for GitHub
* Default: None
* Example: `github_secret`

### Google

#### `AUTH_GOOGLE_ID`

* Type: string (optional)
* Description: The Client ID for Google
* Default: None
* Example: `google_id`

#### `AUTH_GOOGLE_SECRET`

* Type: string (optional)
* Description: The Secret for Google
* Default: None
* Example: `google_secret`


# Basic Environment Variables



## General Environment Variables

### `JWT_SECRET`

* Type: string (required)
* Description: The secret key for JWT signing (at least 32 characters)
* Default: None
* Example: `a-very-long-and-secure-random-string-at-least-32-chars`

### `TYPEORM_CONNECTION`

* Type: string (required)
* Description: The connection string for the database (Connection String)
* Default: None
* Example: `postgres://user:password@localhost:5432/brigid` or `better-sqlite3://./bridge-local-db/data.db`

### `NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL`

* Type: string (optional)
* Description: The public URL of the application, used for CORS and return paths
* Default: `http://localhost:3119`
* Example: `https://brigid.example.com`

## DICOM Environment Variables

### `QUERY_MAX_LIMIT`

* Type: number (optional)
* Description: The maximum limit for query results
* Default: `100`
* Example: `100`

### `DICOM_RECYCLE_BIN_RETENTION_DAYS`

* Type: number (optional)
* Description: The retention period for files in the recycle bin (in days)
* Default: `90`
* Example: `90`

### `DICOM_CLEANUP_RETENTION_DAYS`

* Type: number (optional)
* Description: The retention period for files to be permanently deleted (in days)
* Default: `30`
* Example: `30`

### `DICOM_CLEANUP_INTERVAL_HOURS`

* Type: number (optional)
* Description: The interval for executing cleanup tasks (in hours)
* Default: `24`
* Example: `24`


# DIMSE Service



## DIMSE Service Environment Variables

### General Settings

#### `DIMSE_HOSTNAME`

* Type: string (required)
* Description: The hostname to bind the DIMSE service
* Default: `0.0.0.0`
* Example: `127.0.0.1`

#### `DIMSE_PORT`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The port to bind the DIMSE service
* Default: `11112`
* Example: `11112`

#### `DIMSE_MAX_PDU_LEN_RCV`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The maximum length of the PDU received by the DIMSE service
* Default: `16378`
* Example: `16378`

#### `DIMSE_MAX_PDU_LEN_SND`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The maximum length of the PDU sent by the DIMSE service
* Default: `16378`
* Example: `16378`

#### `DIMSE_NOT_ASYNC`

* Type: boolean (required)
* Description: Whether the DIMSE service is asynchronous
* Default: `false`
* Example: `true`

#### `DIMSE_MAX_OPS_INVOKED`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The maximum number of operations invoked by the DIMSE service
* Default: `0`
* Example: `100`

#### `DIMSE_MAX_OPS_PERFORMED`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The maximum number of operations performed by the DIMSE service
* Default: `0`
* Example: `100`

#### `DIMSE_NOT_PACK_PDV`

* Type: boolean (required)
* Description: Send only one PDV in one P-Data-TF PDU; pack command and data PDV in one P-DATA-TF PDU by default
* Default: `false`
* Example: `true`

#### `DIMSE_CONNECT_TIMEOUT`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The timeout for the DIMSE service connection (TCP) (milliseconds)
* Default: `0`
* Example: `1000`

#### `DIMSE_REQUEST_TIMEOUT`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The timeout for the DIMSE service request (A-ASSOCIATE-RQ) (milliseconds)
* Default: `0`
* Example: `1000`

#### `DIMSE_ACCEPT_TIMEOUT`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The timeout for the DIMSE service accept (A-ASSOCIATE-AC) (milliseconds)
* Default: `0`
* Example: `1000`

#### `DIMSE_RELEASE_TIMEOUT`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The timeout for the DIMSE service release (A-RELEASE-RP) (milliseconds)
* Default: `0`
* Example: `1000`

#### `DIMSE_SEND_TIMEOUT`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The timeout for the DIMSE service send (DIMSE RQs except C-STORE) (milliseconds)
* Default: `0`
* Example: `1000`

#### `DIMSE_STORE_TIMEOUT`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The timeout for the DIMSE service store (C-STORE) (milliseconds)
* Default: `0`
* Example: `1000`

#### `DIMSE_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The timeout for the DIMSE service response (DIMSE RSPs, C-MOVE, C-GET except) (milliseconds)
* Default: `0`
* Example: `1000`

#### `DIMSE_IDLE_TIMEOUT`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The timeout for the DIMSE service idle (milliseconds)
* Default: `0`
* Example: `1000`

#### `DIMSE_SO_CLOSE_DELAY`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The delay for the DIMSE service socket close (milliseconds)
* Default: `50`
* Example: `50`

#### `DIMSE_SO_SND_BUFFER`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The size of the send buffer for the DIMSE service socket (bytes)
* Default: `0`
* Example: `1024`

#### `DIMSE_SO_RCV_BUFFER`

* Type: number (required)
* Description: The size of the receive buffer for the DIMSE service socket (bytes)
* Default: `0`
* Example: `1024`

#### `DIMSE_TCP_NO_DELAY`

* Type: boolean (required)
* Description: Whether the DIMSE service uses TCP No Delay
* Default: `true`
* Example: `true`

Brigid's DIMSE service is implemented using the Dcm4che package, please refer to [Dcm4che QRSCP](https://github.com/dcm4che/dcm4che/blob/master/dcm4che-tool/dcm4che-tool-dcmqrscp/README.md) for detailed environment variables.


# Environment Variables



import { getPageTreePeers } from 'fumadocs-core/page-tree';
import { source } from '@/lib/source';

  {getPageTreePeers(source.getPageTree('en'), '/en/docs/self-hosting/env-info').map((peer) => (
      <Card key={peer.url} title={peer.name} href={peer.url}>
        {peer.description}
      </Card>
    ))}
</Cards>


# Storage Service



## Storage Service Environment Variables

### General Settings

#### `DICOM_STORAGE_FILEPATH`

* Type: string (required)
* Description: The path for storing DICOM files, can use parameters `workspaceId`, `0020000D`, `0020000E`, `00080018` and append `hash` parameter (e.g. `{0020000D,hash}`)
* Default: `/dicom/{workspaceId}/{0020000D,hash}/{0020000E,hash}/{00080018,hash}.dcm`
* Example: `/dicom/{workspaceId}/{0020000D,hash}/{0020000E,hash}/{00080018,hash}.dcm`

#### `STORAGE_PROVIDER`

* Type: string (required)
* Description: The storage provider, can be `local` or `s3`
* Default: `local`
* Example: `s3`

### Local Storage Settings

#### `STORAGE_LOCAL_DIR`

* Type: string (required)
* Description: The directory for storing local files
* Default: `./dicom-files`
* Example: `./dicom-files`

### S3 Settings

#### `S3_ENDPOINT`

* Type: string (required)
* Description: The endpoint for the S3 service
* Default: None
* Example: `http://localhost:9000`

#### `S3_BUCKET`

* Type: string (required)
* Description: The name of the S3 bucket
* Default: None
* Example: `brigid`

#### `S3_ACCESS_KEY`

* Type: string (required)
* Description: The access key for the S3 service
* Default: None
* Example: `access_key`

#### `S3_SECRET_KEY`

* Type: string (required)
* Description: The secret key for the S3 service
* Default: None
* Example: `secret_key`


# Deploy with Docker Compose



import { Step, Steps } from 'fumadocs-ui/components/steps';

## Deployment Steps

<Steps>
  <Step>
    ### Install Docker Environment
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ### Run Docker Compose

    Here is the Docker Compose configuration file for Brigid:

    ```yaml
    services:
        db:
            image: postgres:17-alpine
            container_name: brigid-db
            restart: always
            environment:
            - POSTGRES_USER=${POSTGRES_USER:-postgres}
            - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:-postgres}
            - POSTGRES_DB=${POSTGRES_DB:-brigid}
            volumes:
            - pgdata:/var/lib/postgresql/data
            networks:
            - brigid-network
            healthcheck:
            test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U ${POSTGRES_USER:-postgres} -d ${POSTGRES_DB:-brigid}"]
            interval: 10s
            timeout: 5s
            retries: 5
            start_period: 30s

        brigid-web:
            build:
            context: .
            dockerfile: Dockerfile
            container_name: brigid-web
            restart: always
            ports:
            - "3119:3119"
            environment:
            - NODE_ENV=production
            # Add your environment variables here, or use env_file
            - TYPEORM_CONNECTION=postgres://${POSTGRES_USER:-postgres}:${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:-postgres}@db:5432/${POSTGRES_DB:-brigid}
            depends_on:
            - db
            volumes:
            - ./logs:/app/apps/web/logs
            networks:
            - brigid-network

        networks:
        brigid-network:
            driver: bridge

        volumes:
        pgdata:
    ```
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ### Start Brigid

    Run the following command to start Brigid:

    ```bash
    docker compose up -d
    ```
  </Step>
</Steps>

# Using SEA (Single Executable Application)



import { Step, Steps } from 'fumadocs-ui/components/steps';

## Execution Steps

Brigid provides a single executable version, which you can download from the [Releases](https://github.com/Brigid-DICOM/brigid/releases) page.

<Steps>
  <Step>
    ### Download the single executable file

    Go to the [Releases](https://github.com/Brigid-DICOM/brigid/releases) page, and download the single executable file.

    <Callout title="Note">
      If you want to use the system JRE, you can download the version without JRE, and you must ensure the following:

      * Put the OpenCV libraries in the `lib` (windows is `bin`) directory of the JRE, you can refer to [Manual Configuration of OpenCV Libraries](#manual-configuration-of-opencv-libraries)
      * Java version >= 17
    </Callout>
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ### Extract the files
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ### Run

    Run the `brigid-server` file to start the Brigid service

    Then, open `http://localhost:3119` to enter the Brigid system
  </Step>
</Steps>

## Manual Configuration of OpenCV Libraries

If you choose the version **without an embedded JRE**, you must manually configure the required OpenCV libraries; otherwise, some features may not function properly.

### Windows

* Copy `data/dcm4che/lib/windows-x86-64/opencv_java.dll` to the `bin` directory of the JRE

### Linux

* Copy `data/dcm4che/lib/linux-x86-64/libclib_jiio.so` and `data/dcm4che/lib/linux-x86-64/libopencv_java.so` to the `lib` directory of the JRE

### macOS

* Copy `data/dcm4che/lib/macosx-x86-64/*libopencv_java.dylib` to the `lib` directory of the JRE


# Casdoor









import { Steps, Step } from "fumadocs-ui/components/steps";

## Casdoor OAuth Configuration Steps

<Steps>
  <Step>
    ## Create Organization

    * Navigate to `User Management` -> `Organizations` page
      <img alt="Casdoor User Management - Organizations" src={__img0} placeholder="blur" />
    * Click `Add` button
    * Fill in the `Name`, `Display Name` etc. information
    * Click `Save & Exit` button
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## Create Application

    * Navigate to `Identity` -> `Applications` page
      <img alt="Casdoor Identity - Applications" src={__img1} placeholder="blur" />
    * Click `Add` button
    * Fill in the `Name`, `Display Name` etc. information
    * Click `Save` button
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## Get Client ID and Client Secret

    * Navigate to the recently created Application page
    * Find the `Client ID` and `Client Secret` fields
      <img alt="Casdoor Identity - Application Client ID and Client Secret" src={__img2} placeholder="blur" />
    * Copy the `Client ID` and `Client Secret`
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## Set Up Brigid Environment Variables

    * Set the `Client ID` and `Client Secret` in the `.env` file as the `AUTH_CASDOOR_ID` and `AUTH_CASDOOR_SECRET` environment variables
    * Set the `AUTH_CASDOOR_ISSUER` environment variable to the Casdoor URL, for example: `https://casdoor.example.com`

    When enabling Next Auth authentication, you need to configure the following environment variables:

    | Environment Variable      | Type    | Description                                                      |
    | :------------------------ | :------ | :--------------------------------------------------------------- |
    | `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH` | boolean | Whether to enable the authentication system                      |
    | `NEXTAUTH_SECRET`         | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) used secret key (at least 32 characters)      |
    | `NEXTAUTH_URL`            | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) used URL, usually the URL of your application |
    | `AUTH_CASDOOR_ID`         | string  | Casdoor Client ID                                                |
    | `AUTH_CASDOOR_SECRET`     | string  | Casdoor Client Secret                                            |
    | `AUTH_CASDOOR_ISSUER`     | string  | Casdoor Issuer (usually the URL of Casdoor)                      |

    <Callout type="info">
      Visit [Environment Variables](/en/docs/self-hosting/env-info/auth) for more information about environment variables
    </Callout>
  </Step>
</Steps>


# GitHub









import { Steps, Step } from "fumadocs-ui/components/steps";

## GitHub OAuth Configuration Steps

<Steps>
  <Step>
    ## Create OAuth App

    * Navigate to [GitHub Developer Settings](https://github.com/settings/developers)
    * Click "New OAuth App"
    * Fill in the "Application Name", "Homepage URL", and "Authorization Callback URL"
    * Click "Register application"
      <img alt="GitHub Developer Settings - New OAuth App" src={__img0} placeholder="blur" />
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## Get Client ID and Client Secret

    * Navigate to the recently created OAuth App page
    * Click "Generate a new client secret"
      <img alt="GitHub Developer Settings - Generate Client Secret" src={__img1} placeholder="blur" />
    * After creation, copy the "`Client ID`" and "`Client Secret`"
      <img alt="GitHub Developer Settings - Client Secret" src={__img2} placeholder="blur" />
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## Set Up Brigid Environment Variables

    * Set the "Client ID" and "Client Secret" in the `.env` file as the `AUTH_GITHUB_ID` and `AUTH_GITHUB_SECRET` environment variables

    When enabling Next Auth authentication, you need to configure the following environment variables:

    | Environment Variable      | Type    | Description                                                      |
    | :------------------------ | :------ | :--------------------------------------------------------------- |
    | `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH` | boolean | Whether to enable the authentication system                      |
    | `NEXTAUTH_SECRET`         | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) used secret key (at least 32 characters)      |
    | `NEXTAUTH_URL`            | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) used URL, usually the URL of your application |
    | `AUTH_GITHUB_ID`          | string  | GitHub Client ID                                                 |
    | `AUTH_GITHUB_SECRET`      | string  | GitHub Client Secret                                             |

    <Callout type="info">
      Visit [Environment Variables](/en/docs/self-hosting/env-info/auth) for more information about environment variables
    </Callout>
  </Step>
</Steps>


# Google









import { Steps, Step } from "fumadocs-ui/components/steps";

## Google OAuth Configuration Steps

<Steps>
  <Step>
    ## Select Project

    * Open [Google API Console](https://console.developers.google.com/)
    * Select a project (if you don't have one, please create one)
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## Set Up Google Authentication Platform

    * Navigate to the "OAuth Consent Screen" in the left sidebar
      <img alt="Google API Console - OAuth Consent Screen" src={__img0} placeholder="blur" />
    * Fill in the "Application Name", "User Support Email", "Target Audience", and "Contact Information"
    * Select "External" as the "User Type"
    * Fill in the "Contact Information"
    * Accept the "Terms of Service"
    * Click "Create"
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## Set Up Google Authentication Credentials

    * Click "Create OAuth Client ID" in the "Overview" page
    * Select "Web Application" as the "Application Type"
    * Fill in the "Application Name"
    * Fill in the "Authorized JavaScript Origins" with the URL of your application, e.g. `http://localhost:3119`
    * Fill in the "Authorized Redirect URIs" with the callback URL, e.g. `http://localhost:3119/api/auth/callback/google`
    * Click "Create"
      <img alt="Google API Console - Create OAuth Client ID" src={__img1} placeholder="blur" />
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## Get Client ID and Client Secret

    * Navigate to the "OAuth Clients" in the left sidebar
    * Click the OAuth Client you just created
    * Copy the "Client ID" and "Client Secret"
      <img alt="Google API Console - OAuth Client Details" src={__img2} placeholder="blur" />
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## Set Up Brigid Environment Variables

    * Set the `AUTH_GOOGLE_ID` and `AUTH_GOOGLE_SECRET` environment variables in the `.env` file as the Client ID and Client Secret you got from the Google API Console

    When enabling Next Auth authentication, you need to configure the following environment variables:

    | Environment Variable      | Type    | Description                                 |
    | :------------------------ | :------ | :------------------------------------------ |
    | `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH` | boolean | Whether to enable the authentication system |
    | `NEXTAUTH_SECRET`         | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) ä½¿ç”¨çš„é‡‘é‘° (è‡³å°‘ 32 å­—å…ƒ)         |
    | `NEXTAUTH_URL`            | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) ä½¿ç”¨çš„ URLï¼Œé€šå¸¸ç‚ºæ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼çš„ç¶²å€       |
    | `AUTH_GOOGLE_ID`          | string  | Google çš„ Client ID                          |
    | `AUTH_GOOGLE_SECRET`      | string  | Google çš„ Client Secret                      |

    <Callout type="info">
      Visit [Environment Variables](/en/docs/self-hosting/env-info/auth) for more information about environment variables
    </Callout>
  </Step>
</Steps>


# Authentication



Brigid do not enable authentication by default, if you need to enable it, please set `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH=true` in the `.env` file and configure the corresponding authentication settings

Brigid supports using Next Auth (Auth.js) to configure external authentication systems for internal use, unified management of user authorization

## Next Auth

Before using Next Auth, please set `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH=true` in the `.env` file and configure the corresponding authentication settings

Below are the environment variables for Next Auth in Brigid:

| Environment Variable      | Type    | Description                                 |
| :------------------------ | :------ | :------------------------------------------ |
| `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH` | boolean | Whether to enable the authentication system |
| `NEXTAUTH_SECRET`         | string  | The secret key for NextAuth (Auth.js)       |
| `NEXTAUTH_URL`            | string  | The URL for NextAuth (Auth.js)              |


# Components



## Code Block

```js
console.log('Hello World');
```

## Cards

<Cards>
  <Card title="Learn more about Next.js" href="https://nextjs.org/docs" />

  <Card title="Learn more about Fumadocs" href="https://fumadocs.dev" />
</Cards>


# Brigid - ç¸½è¦½ä»‹ç´¹





## æ ¸å¿ƒåŠŸèƒ½

import { getPageTreePeers } from 'fumadocs-core/page-tree';
import { source } from '@/lib/source';

<img alt="Overview" src={__img0} placeholder="blur" />

<Cards>
  {getPageTreePeers(source.getPageTree('zh-TW'), '/zh-TW/docs/core-features').map((peer) => (
      <Card key={peer.url} title={peer.name} href={peer.url}>
        {peer.description}
      </Card>
    ))}
</Cards>

## ğŸ“„ DICOM ç®¡ç†åŠŸèƒ½

Brigid æ”¯æ´å…¨é¢çš„ DICOM å½±åƒç®¡ç†ï¼ŒåŒ…å«æª¢ç´¢ã€å­˜å–èˆ‡åˆªé™¤

## ğŸ“‚ ç›´è¦ºçš„å±¤ç´šåŒ–ç®¡ç†

Brigid å°‡å½±åƒä¾æ“š DICOM æ¨™æº–åˆ†ç‚º `Study` â†’ `Series` â†’ `Instance` ä¸‰å€‹å±¤ç´š

å°±åƒä½¿ç”¨è³‡æ–™å¤¾ä¸€æ¨£ç°¡å–®ï¼Œæ‚¨å¯ä»¥å¾ç—…æ‚£çš„å–®æ¬¡æª¢æŸ¥ä¸€è·¯æ·±å…¥åˆ°æ¯ä¸€å¼µå½±åƒç´°ç¯€

* è‡ªå®šç¾©è­˜åˆ¥ï¼šå¯è¨­å®šã€Œåˆ†äº«åç¨±ã€èˆ‡ã€Œæè¿°ã€ï¼Œæ–¹ä¾¿è¿½è¹¤èˆ‡ç®¡ç†
* æ¬Šé™æ§ç®¡ï¼š
  * æ“ä½œæ¬Šé™ï¼šæ”¯æŒ `READ` (æª¢è¦–/ä¸‹è¼‰) èˆ‡ `EDIT` (ç·¨è¼¯ Tag) æ¬Šé™
  * å°è±¡ç®¡ç†ï¼šå¯ç²¾ç¢ºæŒ‡å®š`ç‰¹å®šä½¿ç”¨è€…`æˆ–é–‹æ”¾`æ‰€æœ‰äºº`å­˜å–

# äº‹ä»¶æ—¥èªŒ





<img alt="Event Logs preview screenshot" src={__img0} placeholder="blur" />

Brigid å…§å»ºäº‹ä»¶æ—¥èªŒç³»çµ±ï¼Œè¨˜éŒ„å¹³å°é‹è¡Œçš„å„é …æ“ä½œã€‚ç®¡ç†å“¡å¯é€éæ—¥èªŒç›£æ§ç³»çµ±ç‹€æ…‹ã€è¿½è¹¤ä½¿ç”¨è€…è¡Œç‚ºï¼Œä¸¦åœ¨ç™¼ç”Ÿç•°å¸¸æ™‚é€²è¡Œå¿«é€Ÿæ’éŒ¯

## äº‹ä»¶æ—¥èªŒåŠŸèƒ½

* **æ—¥èªŒæª¢è¦–**ï¼šå³æ™‚æŸ¥çœ‹ç³»çµ±ç”¢ç”Ÿçš„æ‰€æœ‰äº‹ä»¶è¨˜éŒ„
* **å¤šç¶­åº¦ç¯©é¸**ï¼š
  * **å±¤ç´šéæ¿¾ (Level Filter)**ï¼šæ”¯æ´ Info (è³‡è¨Š)ã€Warning (è­¦å‘Š) åŠ Error (éŒ¯èª¤) ä¸‰ç¨®ç­‰ç´šï¼Œå¹«åŠ©å¿«é€Ÿé–å®šç•°å¸¸
  * **äº‹ä»¶åç¨±æœå°‹ (Name Filter)**ï¼šå¯é‡å°ç‰¹å®šçš„ DICOM æ“ä½œè¡Œç‚ºé€²è¡Œç²¾ç¢ºæª¢ç´¢

## æ”¯æ´çš„äº‹ä»¶é¡å‹ (Event Names)

ç‚ºäº†ä¾¿æ–¼ç®¡ç†èˆ‡ç²¾ç¢ºæ’éŒ¯ï¼ŒBrigid å°‡ DICOM ç›¸é—œäº‹ä»¶ç´°åˆ†ç‚ºä»¥ä¸‹é¡åˆ¥ã€‚æ‚¨å¯ä»¥æ ¹æ“šé€™äº›ç‰¹å®šçš„äº‹ä»¶åç¨±é€²è¡Œç¯©é¸ï¼š

| åˆ†é¡                     | æ”¯æ´çš„äº‹ä»¶åç¨± (Event Name)                                                                                     |
| :--------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **è³‡æ–™å„²å­˜ (Storage)**     | `storeInstance`                                                                                          |
| **å½±åƒæŸ¥è©¢ (Search)**      | `searchStudies`, `searchSeries`, `searchInstances`, `searchStudySeries`, `searchStudySeriesInstances`    |
| **å½±åƒæª¢ç´¢ (Retrieve)**    | `retrieveStudy`, `retrieveSeries`, `retrieveInstance`                                                    |
| **è¦–è¦ºåŒ–å½±åƒæª¢ç´¢ (Rendered)** | `retrieveRenderedSeries`, `retrieveRenderedInstance`, `retrieveRenderedFrames`, `retrieveFramePixelData` |
| **ç¸®åœ–ç²å– (Thumbnail)**   | `retrieveStudyThumbnail`, `retrieveSeriesThumbnail`, `retrieveInstanceThumbnail`                         |
| **ä¸­ç¹¼è³‡æ–™ (Metadata)**    | `retrieveStudyMetadata`, `retrieveSeriesMetadata`, `retrieveInstanceMetadata`                            |

Brigid æä¾›å¯åŸ·è¡Œæ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼ï¼Œæ–¹ä¾¿ä½¿ç”¨è€…å¿«é€Ÿé–‹å§‹ä½¿ç”¨

ä½ å¯ä»¥åˆ° [Releases](https://github.com/Brigid-DICOM/brigid/releases) é é¢ä¸‹è¼‰ Brigid çš„å¯åŸ·è¡Œæ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼

* å·¥ä½œå€ç®¡ç†ï¼šå»ºç«‹ã€åˆªé™¤å’Œç®¡ç†å·¥ä½œå€

# ä¸Šå‚³ DICOM





<img alt="Upload DICOM preview animation" src={__img0} />

# èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰



## Next Auth èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸

### é€šç”¨è¨­ç½®

#### `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH`

* é¡å‹ï¼šboolean (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šæ˜¯å¦å•Ÿç”¨èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰åŠŸèƒ½
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`false`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`true`

#### `NEXTAUTH_SECRET`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šNextAuth (Auth.js) ä½¿ç”¨çš„é‡‘é‘° (è‡³å°‘ 32 å­—å…ƒ)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`a-very-long-and-secure-random-string-at-least-32-chars`

#### `NEXTAUTH_URL`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šNextAuth (Auth.js) ä½¿ç”¨çš„ URL
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`http://localhost:3119`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`https://brigid.example.com`

### Casdoor

#### `AUTH_CASDOOR_ID`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šCasdoor çš„ Client ID
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`casdoor_id`

#### `AUTH_CASDOOR_SECRET`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šCasdoor çš„ Secret
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`casdoor_secret`

#### `AUTH_CASDOOR_ISSUER`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šCasdoor çš„ Issuer (é€šå¸¸æ˜¯ Casdoor çš„ URL)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`https://casdoor.example.com`

### GitHub

#### `AUTH_GITHUB_ID`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šGitHub çš„ Client ID
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`github_id`

#### `AUTH_GITHUB_SECRET`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šGitHub çš„ Secret
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`github_secret`

### Google

#### `AUTH_GOOGLE_ID`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šGoogle çš„ Client ID
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`google_id`

#### `AUTH_GOOGLE_SECRET`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šGoogle çš„ Secret
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`google_secret`


# åŸºæœ¬ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸



## é€šç”¨ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸

### `JWT_SECRET`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šç”¨æ–¼åŠ å¯†èˆ‡é©—è­‰æ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼å…§éƒ¨ JWT Token çš„ç§é‘°ã€‚é•·åº¦éœ€åœ¨ 32 åˆ° 255 å­—å…ƒä¹‹é–“
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`a-very-long-and-secure-random-string-at-least-32-chars`

### `TYPEORM_CONNECTION`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šè³‡æ–™åº«é€£æ¥å­—ä¸²ï¼ˆConnection Stringï¼‰ï¼Œç”¨æ–¼ TypeORM é€£æ¥è³‡æ–™åº«
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`postgres://user:password@localhost:5432/brigid` æˆ– `better-sqlite3://./bridge-local-db/data.db`

### `NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šæ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼çš„å‰ç«¯å…¬é–‹ç¶²å€ï¼Œç”¨æ–¼ CORS ä»¥åŠå›å‚³è·¯å¾‘
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`http://localhost:3119`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`https://brigid.example.com`

## DICOM ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸

### `QUERY_MAX_LIMIT`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šæŸ¥è©¢çµæœçš„æœ€å¤§é™åˆ¶
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`100`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`100`

### `DICOM_RECYCLE_BIN_RETENTION_DAYS`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šå›æ”¶æ¡¶æª”æ¡ˆä¿ç•™å¤©æ•¸
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`90`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`90`

### `DICOM_CLEANUP_RETENTION_DAYS`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šæ°¸ä¹…åˆªé™¤æª”æ¡ˆä¿ç•™å¤©æ•¸
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`30`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`30`

### `DICOM_CLEANUP_INTERVAL_HOURS`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (optional)
* æè¿°ï¼šæ¸…ç†ä»»å‹™åŸ·è¡Œé–“éš” (å°æ™‚)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`24`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`24`


# DIMSE æœå‹™



## DIMSE Service Environment Variables

### é€šç”¨è¨­ç½®

#### `DIMSE_HOSTNAME`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™ç¶å®šä¸»æ©Ÿ
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0.0.0.0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`127.0.0.1`

#### `DIMSE_PORT`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™ç¶å®šåŸ è™Ÿ
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`11112`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`11112`

#### `DIMSE_MAX_PDU_LEN_RCV`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™æ¥æ”¶ PDU æœ€å¤§é•·åº¦
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`16378`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`16378`

#### `DIMSE_MAX_PDU_LEN_SND`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™ç™¼é€ PDU æœ€å¤§é•·åº¦
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`16378`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`16378`

#### `DIMSE_NOT_ASYNC`

* é¡å‹ï¼šboolean (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™æ˜¯å¦ç‚ºéåŒæ­¥æ¨¡å¼
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`false`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`true`

#### `DIMSE_MAX_OPS_INVOKED`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™æœ€å¤§æ“ä½œæ•¸
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`100`

#### `DIMSE_MAX_OPS_PERFORMED`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™æœ€å¤§æ“ä½œæ•¸
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`100`

#### `DIMSE_NOT_PACK_PDV`

* é¡å‹ï¼šboolean (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šåœ¨å–®ä¸€ P-Data-TF PDU ä¸­åªç™¼é€ä¸€å€‹ PDVï¼›é è¨­ç‚ºå‘½ä»¤å’Œè³‡æ–™ PDV æ‰“åŒ…åœ¨ä¸€å€‹ P-DATA-TF PDU ä¸­
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`false`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`true`

#### `DIMSE_CONNECT_TIMEOUT`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™é€£æ¥ (TCP) è¶…æ™‚æ™‚é–“ (æ¯«ç§’)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`1000`

#### `DIMSE_REQUEST_TIMEOUT`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™æ¥æ”¶ (A-ASSOCIATE-RQ) è¶…æ™‚æ™‚é–“ (æ¯«ç§’)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`1000`

#### `DIMSE_ACCEPT_TIMEOUT`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™æ¥å— (A-ASSOCIATE-AC) è¶…æ™‚æ™‚é–“ (æ¯«ç§’)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`1000`

#### `DIMSE_RELEASE_TIMEOUT`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™é‡‹æ”¾ (A-RELEASE-RP) è¶…æ™‚æ™‚é–“ (æ¯«ç§’)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`1000`

#### `DIMSE_SEND_TIMEOUT`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™ç™¼é€ DIMSE RQs (C-STORE é™¤å¤–) è¶…æ™‚æ™‚é–“ (æ¯«ç§’)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`1000`

#### `DIMSE_STORE_TIMEOUT`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™å„²å­˜ (C-STORE) è¶…æ™‚æ™‚é–“ (æ¯«ç§’)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`1000`

#### `DIMSE_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™æ¥æ”¶ (DIMSE RSPs, C-MOVE, C-GET é™¤å¤–) å›æ‡‰è¶…æ™‚æ™‚é–“ (æ¯«ç§’)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`1000`

#### `DIMSE_IDLE_TIMEOUT`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™åœæ­¢ Association é–’ç½®è¶…æ™‚æ™‚é–“ (æ¯«ç§’)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`1000`

#### `DIMSE_SO_CLOSE_DELAY`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™é—œé–‰å»¶é²æ™‚é–“ (æ¯«ç§’)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`50`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`50`

#### `DIMSE_SO_SND_BUFFER`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™ç™¼é€ç·©è¡å€å¤§å° (bytes)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`1024`

#### `DIMSE_SO_RCV_BUFFER`

* é¡å‹ï¼šnumber (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™æ¥æ”¶ç·©è¡å€å¤§å° (bytes)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`0`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`1024`

#### `DIMSE_TCP_NO_DELAY`

* é¡å‹ï¼šboolean (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDIMSE æœå‹™æ˜¯å¦ä½¿ç”¨ TCP No Delay
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`true`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`true`

Brigid çš„ DIMSE æœå‹™ä½¿ç”¨ Dcm4che å¥—ä»¶å¯¦ç¾ï¼Œè©³ç´°ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸å¯åƒç…§ [Dcm4che QRSCP](https://github.com/dcm4che/dcm4che/blob/master/dcm4che-tool/dcm4che-tool-dcmqrscp/README.md)


# ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸



import { getPageTreePeers } from 'fumadocs-core/page-tree';
import { source } from '@/lib/source';

<Cards>
  {getPageTreePeers(source.getPageTree('zh-TW'), '/zh-TW/docs/self-hosting/env-info').map((peer) => (
      <Card key={peer.url} title={peer.name} href={peer.url}>
        {peer.description}
      </Card>
    ))}
</Cards>


# å„²å­˜æœå‹™



## å„²å­˜æœå‹™ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸

### é€šç”¨è¨­ç½®

#### `DICOM_STORAGE_FILEPATH`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šDICOM æª”æ¡ˆå„²å­˜è·¯å¾‘ï¼Œå¯ä½¿ç”¨åƒæ•¸ `workspaceId`, `0020000D`, `0020000E`, `00080018` ä»¥åŠè£œä¸Š `hash` åƒæ•¸ (å¦‚ï¼š `{0020000D,hash}`)
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`/dicom/{workspaceId}/{0020000D,hash}/{0020000E,hash}/{00080018,hash}.dcm`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`/dicom/{workspaceId}/{0020000D,hash}/{0020000E,hash}/{00080018,hash}.dcm`

#### `STORAGE_PROVIDER`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šå„²å­˜æœå‹™æä¾›è€…ï¼Œå¯é¸æ“‡ `local` æˆ– `s3`
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`local`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`s3`

### æœ¬åœ°å„²å­˜ (local) è¨­ç½®

#### `STORAGE_LOCAL_DIR`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šæª”æ¡ˆå­˜æ”¾è·¯å¾‘
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼š`./dicom-files`
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`./dicom-files`

### S3 è¨­ç½®

#### `S3_ENDPOINT`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šS3 æœå‹™ç¶²å€
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`http://localhost:9000`

#### `S3_BUCKET`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šS3 Bucket åç¨±
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`brigid`

#### `S3_ACCESS_KEY`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šS3 Access Key
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`access_key`

#### `S3_SECRET_KEY`

* é¡å‹ï¼šstring (required)
* æè¿°ï¼šS3 Secret Key
* é è¨­å€¼ï¼šç„¡
* ç¯„ä¾‹ï¼š`secret_key`


# ä½¿ç”¨ Docker Compose éƒ¨ç½²



import { Step, Steps } from 'fumadocs-ui/components/steps';

## éƒ¨å±¬æ­¥é©Ÿ

<Steps>
  <Step>
    ### å®‰è£ Docker ç’°å¢ƒ
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ### é‹è¡Œ Docker Compose

    ä»¥ä¸‹æ˜¯ Brigid çš„ Docker Compose è¨­å®šæª”ï¼š

    ```yaml
    services:
        db:
            image: postgres:17-alpine
            container_name: brigid-db
            restart: always
            environment:
            - POSTGRES_USER=${POSTGRES_USER:-postgres}
            - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:-postgres}
            - POSTGRES_DB=${POSTGRES_DB:-brigid}
            volumes:
            - pgdata:/var/lib/postgresql/data
            networks:
            - brigid-network
            healthcheck:
            test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U ${POSTGRES_USER:-postgres} -d ${POSTGRES_DB:-brigid}"]
            interval: 10s
            timeout: 5s
            retries: 5
            start_period: 30s

        brigid-web:
            build:
            context: .
            dockerfile: Dockerfile
            container_name: brigid-web
            restart: always
            ports:
            - "3119:3119"
            environment:
            - NODE_ENV=production
            # åœ¨æ­¤åŠ å…¥ä½ çš„ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸ï¼Œæˆ–ä½¿ç”¨ env_file
            - TYPEORM_CONNECTION=postgres://${POSTGRES_USER:-postgres}:${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:-postgres}@db:5432/${POSTGRES_DB:-brigid}
            depends_on:
            - db
            volumes:
            - ./logs:/app/apps/web/logs
            networks:
            - brigid-network

        networks:
        brigid-network:
            driver: bridge

        volumes:
        pgdata:
    ```

    æ¥ä¸‹ä¾†ï¼Œé‹è¡Œä»¥ä¸‹æŒ‡ä»¤å•Ÿå‹• Brigidï¼š

    ```bash
    docker compose up -d
    ```
  </Step>
</Steps>

# ä½¿ç”¨å–®ä¸€åŸ·è¡Œæª”



import { Step, Steps } from 'fumadocs-ui/components/steps';

## åŸ·è¡Œæ­¥é©Ÿ

Brigid æä¾›å–®ä¸€åŸ·è¡Œæª”çš„ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼Œä½ å¯ä»¥åœ¨ [Releases](https://github.com/Brigid-DICOM/brigid/releases) é é¢ä¸‹è¼‰ Brigid çš„å–®ä¸€åŸ·è¡Œæª”

<Steps>
  <Step>
    ### ä¸‹è¼‰å–®ä¸€åŸ·è¡Œæª”

    é€²å…¥ [Releases](https://github.com/Brigid-DICOM/brigid/releases) é é¢ï¼Œä¸‹è¼‰ Brigid çš„å–®ä¸€åŸ·è¡Œæª”

    <Callout title="æ³¨æ„">
      å¦‚æœä½ æƒ³ä½¿ç”¨ç³»çµ±çš„ JREï¼Œå¯ä»¥ä¸‹è¼‰ä¸å« JRE çš„ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼Œä¸”å¿…é ˆç¢ºèªä»¥ä¸‹äº‹é …ï¼š

      * åœ¨ JRE çš„ `lib` (windows ç‚º `bin`) ç›®éŒ„ä¸‹ï¼Œæ”¾ç½® OpenCV çš„å‡½å¼åº«ï¼Œå¯åƒè€ƒ[æ‰‹å‹•é…ç½® OpenCV å‡½å¼åº«](#æ‰‹å‹•é…ç½®-opencv-å‡½å¼åº«)
      * Java ç‰ˆæœ¬ >= 17
    </Callout>
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ### è§£å£“ç¸®
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ### åŸ·è¡Œ

    åŸ·è¡Œ `brigid-server` æª”æ¡ˆå•Ÿå‹• Brigid æœå‹™

    æ¥ä¸‹ä¾†ï¼Œæ‰“é–‹ `http://localhost:3119` å³å¯é€²å…¥ Brigid ç³»çµ±
  </Step>
</Steps>

## æ‰‹å‹•é…ç½® OpenCV å‡½å¼åº«

å¦‚æœé¸æ“‡**ä¸å« JRE çš„ç‰ˆæœ¬**ï¼Œè«‹å‹™å¿…æ‰‹å‹•é…ç½®æ‰€éœ€çš„ OpenCV å‡½å¼åº«ï¼Œå¦å‰‡éƒ¨åˆ†åŠŸèƒ½å°‡ç„¡æ³•æ­£å¸¸é‹ä½œ

### Windows

* è«‹å°‡ `data/dcm4che/lib/windows-x86-64/opencv_java.dll` è¤‡è£½åˆ° JRE çš„ `bin` ç›®éŒ„

### Linux

* è«‹å°‡ `data/dcm4che/lib/linux-x86-64/libclib_jiio.so` èˆ‡ `data/dcm4che/lib/linux-x86-64/libopencv_java.so` è¤‡è£½åˆ° JRE çš„ `lib` ç›®éŒ„

### macOS

* è«‹å°‡ `data/dcm4che/lib/macosx-x86-64/*libopencv_java.dylib` è¤‡è£½åˆ° JRE çš„ `lib` ç›®éŒ„


# Casdoor















import { Steps, Step } from "fumadocs-ui/components/steps";

## Casdoor OAuth é…ç½®æµç¨‹

<Steps>
  <Step>
    ## å‰µå»º Organization

    * å‰å¾€ `User Management` -> `Organizations` é é¢
      <img alt="Casdoor User Management - Organizations" src={__img0} placeholder="blur" />
    * é»æ“Š `Add` æŒ‰éˆ•
    * å¡«å¯« `Name`, `Display Name` ç­‰è³‡è¨Š
    * é»æ“Š `Save & Exit` æŒ‰éˆ•
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## å‰µå»º Application

    * å‰å¾€ `Identity` -> `Applications` é é¢
      <img alt="Casdoor Identity - Applications" src={__img1} placeholder="blur" />
    * é»æ“Š `Add` æŒ‰éˆ•
    * å¡«å¯« `Name`, `Display Name` ç­‰è³‡è¨Š
      <img alt="Casdoor Identity - Add Application" src={__img2} placeholder="blur" />
    * è¨­å®š `Redirect URLs`ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ï¼š`http://localhost:3119/api/auth/callback/casdoor`
      <img alt="Casdoor Identity - Add Application Redirect URLs" src={__img3} placeholder="blur" />
    * é—œé–‰è¨»å†Š
      * ç‚ºäº†ä¿è­‰æ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼çš„å®‰å…¨æ€§ï¼Œå»ºè­°é—œé–‰ Casdoor çš„è¨»å†ŠåŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œç”±ç®¡ç†å“¡æ‰‹å‹•æ–°å¢ä½¿ç”¨è€…
      * å°‡ `Enable Signup` è¨­ç‚º `false`
        <img alt="Casdoor Identity - Disable Signup" src={__img4} placeholder="blur" />
    * é»æ“Š `Save` æŒ‰éˆ•
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## ç²å– Client ID å’Œ Client Secret

    * é€²å…¥å‰›å‰›å»ºç«‹çš„ Application é é¢
    * æ‰¾åˆ° `Client ID` å’Œ `Client Secret` æ¬„ä½
      <img alt="Casdoor Identity - Application Client ID and Client Secret" src={__img5} placeholder="blur" />
    * è¤‡è£½ `Client ID` å’Œ `Client Secret`
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## è¨­å®š Brigid çš„ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸

    * å°‡ç²å–åˆ°çš„ Client ID å’Œ Client Secret è¨­å®šæ”¾åœ¨ Brigid çš„ `.env` æª”æ¡ˆçš„ `AUTH_CASDOOR_ID` å’Œ `AUTH_CASDOOR_SECRET` ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸
    * è¨­å®š `AUTH_CASDOOR_ISSUER` ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸ç‚º Casdoor çš„ URLï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ï¼š`https://casdoor.example.com`

    åœ¨å•Ÿç”¨ Next Auth èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰æ™‚ï¼Œä½ éœ€è¦é…ç½®ä»¥ä¸‹ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸ï¼š

    | ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸                      | é¡å‹      | æè¿°                                    |
    | :------------------------ | :------ | :------------------------------------ |
    | `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH` | boolean | æ˜¯å¦å•Ÿç”¨èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰åŠŸèƒ½                            |
    | `NEXTAUTH_SECRET`         | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) ä½¿ç”¨çš„é‡‘é‘° (è‡³å°‘ 32 å­—å…ƒ)   |
    | `NEXTAUTH_URL`            | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) ä½¿ç”¨çš„ URLï¼Œé€šå¸¸ç‚ºæ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼çš„ç¶²å€ |
    | `AUTH_CASDOOR_ID`         | string  | Casdoor çš„ Client ID                   |
    | `AUTH_CASDOOR_SECRET`     | string  | Casdoor çš„ Client Secret               |
    | `AUTH_CASDOOR_ISSUER`     | string  | Casdoor çš„ Issuer (é€šå¸¸æ˜¯ Casdoor çš„ URL)  |

    <Callout type="info">
      å‰å¾€[ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸](/zh-TW/docs/self-hosting/env-info/auth)å¯æŸ¥é–±æ›´å¤šç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸çš„è¨­å®šæ–¹å¼
    </Callout>
  </Step>
</Steps>


# GitHub









import { Steps, Step } from "fumadocs-ui/components/steps";

## GitHub OAuth é…ç½®æµç¨‹

<Steps>
  <Step>
    ## å‰µå»º OAuth App

    * é€²å…¥ [GitHub Developer Settings](https://github.com/settings/developers)
    * é»æ“Šã€ŒNew OAuth Appã€
    * å¡«å¯«ã€ŒApplication Nameã€
    * å¡«å¯«ã€ŒHomepage URLã€ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ï¼š`http://localhost:3119`
    * å¡«å¯«ã€ŒAuthorization Callback URLã€ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ï¼š`http://localhost:3119/api/auth/callback/github`
    * é»æ“Šã€ŒRegister applicationã€
      <img alt="GitHub Developer Settings - New OAuth App" src={__img0} placeholder="blur" />
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## ç²å– Client ID å’Œ Client Secret

    * é€²å…¥å‰›å‰›å»ºç«‹çš„ OAuth App é é¢
    * é»æ“Šã€ŒGenerate a new client secretã€
      <img alt="GitHub Developer Settings - Generate Client Secret" src={__img1} placeholder="blur" />
    * å‰µå»ºå¾Œï¼Œè¤‡è£½ã€Œ`Client ID`ã€å’Œã€Œ`Client Secret`ã€
      <img alt="GitHub Developer Settings - Client Secret" src={__img2} placeholder="blur" />
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## è¨­å®š Brigid çš„ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸

    * å°‡ç²å–åˆ°çš„ Client ID å’Œ Client Secret è¨­å®šæ”¾åœ¨ Brigid çš„ `.env` æª”æ¡ˆçš„ `AUTH_GITHUB_ID` å’Œ `AUTH_GITHUB_SECRET` ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸

    åœ¨å•Ÿç”¨ Next Auth èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰æ™‚ï¼Œä½ éœ€è¦é…ç½®ä»¥ä¸‹ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸ï¼š

    | ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸                      | é¡å‹      | æè¿°                                    |
    | :------------------------ | :------ | :------------------------------------ |
    | `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH` | boolean | æ˜¯å¦å•Ÿç”¨èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰åŠŸèƒ½                            |
    | `NEXTAUTH_SECRET`         | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) ä½¿ç”¨çš„é‡‘é‘° (è‡³å°‘ 32 å­—å…ƒ)   |
    | `NEXTAUTH_URL`            | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) ä½¿ç”¨çš„ URLï¼Œé€šå¸¸ç‚ºæ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼çš„ç¶²å€ |
    | `AUTH_GITHUB_ID`          | string  | GitHub çš„ Client ID                    |
    | `AUTH_GITHUB_SECRET`      | string  | GitHub çš„ Client Secret                |

    <Callout type="info">
      å‰å¾€[ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸](/zh-TW/docs/self-hosting/env-info/auth)å¯æŸ¥é–±æ›´å¤šç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸çš„è¨­å®šæ–¹å¼
    </Callout>
  </Step>
</Steps>


# Google









import { Steps, Step } from "fumadocs-ui/components/steps";

## Google OAuth é…ç½®æµç¨‹

<Steps>
  <Step>
    ## é¸æ“‡å°ˆæ¡ˆ

    * æ‰“é–‹ [Google API Console](https://console.developers.google.com/)
    * é¸å–å°ˆæ¡ˆ (å¦‚æœæ²’æœ‰ï¼Œè«‹å…ˆå»ºç«‹ä¸€å€‹)
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## è¨­å®š Google é©—è­‰å¹³å°

    * é€²å…¥å·¦é‚Šå°èˆªåˆ—çš„ã€ŒOAuth åŒæ„ç•«é¢ã€
      <img alt="Google API Console - OAuth åŒæ„ç•«é¢" src={__img0} placeholder="blur" />
    * é»æ“Šã€Œé–‹å§‹ã€
    * å¡«å¯«ã€Œæ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼åç¨±ã€ã€ã€Œä½¿ç”¨è€…æ”¯æ´é›»å­éƒµä»¶ã€
    * ç›®æ¨™å°è±¡é¸æ“‡ã€Œå¤–éƒ¨ã€
    * å¡«å¯«è¯çµ¡è³‡è¨Š
    * åŒæ„ä½¿ç”¨è€…æ¢æ¬¾
    * é»æ“Šã€Œå»ºç«‹ã€
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## è¨­å®š Google é©—è­‰æ†‘è­‰

    * åœ¨ã€Œç¸½è¦½ã€ç•«é¢ï¼Œé»æ“Šã€Œå»ºç«‹ OAuth ç”¨æˆ¶ç«¯ã€
    * æ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼é¡å‹é¸æ“‡ã€Œç¶²é æ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼ã€
    * å¡«å¯«åç¨±
    * å·²æˆæ¬Šçš„ JavaScript ä¾†æºå¡«å¯«ä½ çš„æ‡‰ç”¨çš„ç¶²åŸŸï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ï¼š`http://localhost:3119`
    * å·²æˆæ¬Šçš„é‡æ–°å°å‘ URI å¡«å¯«å°æ‡‰ callback ç¶²å€ï¼Œä¾‹å¦‚ï¼š`http://localhost:3119/api/auth/callback/google`
    * é»æ“Šã€Œå»ºç«‹ã€
      <img alt="Google API Console - å»ºç«‹ OAuth ç”¨æˆ¶ç«¯" src={__img1} placeholder="blur" />
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## å–å¾— Client ID å’Œ Client Secret

    * é€²å…¥å·¦é‚Šå°èˆªåˆ—çš„ã€Œç”¨æˆ¶ç«¯ã€ï¼Œé»æ“Šå‰›å‰›å»ºç«‹çš„ç”¨æˆ¶ç«¯ï¼Œé€²å…¥è©³ç´°è³‡è¨Šé é¢
    * è¤‡è£½ã€Œç”¨æˆ¶ç«¯ IDã€å’Œã€Œç”¨æˆ¶ç«¯å¯†ç¢¼ã€
      <img alt="Google API Console - ç”¨æˆ¶ç«¯è©³ç´°è³‡è¨Š" src={__img2} placeholder="blur" />
  </Step>

  <Step>
    ## è¨­å®š Brigid çš„ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸

    * å°‡ç²å–åˆ°çš„ Client ID å’Œ Client Secret è¨­å®šæ”¾åœ¨ Brigid çš„ `.env` æª”æ¡ˆçš„ `AUTH_GOOGLE_ID` å’Œ `AUTH_GOOGLE_SECRET` ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸

    åœ¨å•Ÿç”¨ Next Auth èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰æ™‚ï¼Œä½ éœ€è¦é…ç½®ä»¥ä¸‹ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸ï¼š

    | ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸                      | é¡å‹      | æè¿°                                    |
    | :------------------------ | :------ | :------------------------------------ |
    | `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH` | boolean | æ˜¯å¦å•Ÿç”¨èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰åŠŸèƒ½                            |
    | `NEXTAUTH_SECRET`         | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) ä½¿ç”¨çš„é‡‘é‘° (è‡³å°‘ 32 å­—å…ƒ)   |
    | `NEXTAUTH_URL`            | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) ä½¿ç”¨çš„ URLï¼Œé€šå¸¸ç‚ºæ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼çš„ç¶²å€ |
    | `AUTH_GOOGLE_ID`          | string  | Google çš„ Client ID                    |
    | `AUTH_GOOGLE_SECRET`      | string  | Google çš„ Client Secret                |

    <Callout type="info">
      å‰å¾€[ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸](/zh-TW/docs/self-hosting/env-info/auth)å¯æŸ¥é–±æ›´å¤šç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸çš„è¨­å®šæ–¹å¼
    </Callout>
  </Step>
</Steps>


# èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰



import { getPageTreePeers } from 'fumadocs-core/page-tree';
import { source } from '@/lib/source';

Brigid é è¨­ä¸å•Ÿç”¨èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰åŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œè‹¥éœ€è¦å•Ÿç”¨ï¼Œè«‹åœ¨ `.env` æª”æ¡ˆä¸­è¨­å®š `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH=true`ï¼Œä¸¦è¨­å®šç›¸æ‡‰çš„èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰é…ç½®

Brigid æ”¯æŒä½¿ç”¨ Next Auth (Auth.js) é…ç½®å¤–éƒ¨èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰ç³»çµ±ï¼Œä¾›çµ„ç¹”å…§éƒ¨ä½¿ç”¨ï¼Œçµ±ä¸€ç®¡ç†ä½¿ç”¨è€…æˆæ¬Š

## Next Auth

åœ¨ä½¿ç”¨ Next Auth ä¹‹å‰ï¼Œè«‹å…ˆåœ¨ Brigid çš„ `.env` æª”æ¡ˆä¸­è¨­å®š `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH=true`ï¼Œä¸¦è¨­å®šç›¸æ‡‰çš„èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰é…ç½®

ä»¥ä¸‹æ˜¯ Brigid çš„ Next Auth ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸ï¼š

| ç’°å¢ƒè®Šæ•¸                      | é¡å‹      | æè¿°                                  |
| :------------------------ | :------ | :---------------------------------- |
| `NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_AUTH` | boolean | æ˜¯å¦å•Ÿç”¨èº«åˆ†é©—è­‰åŠŸèƒ½                          |
| `NEXTAUTH_SECRET`         | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) ä½¿ç”¨çš„é‡‘é‘° (è‡³å°‘ 32 å­—å…ƒ) |
| `NEXTAUTH_URL`            | string  | NextAuth (Auth.js) ä½¿ç”¨çš„ URL          |

<Cards>
